single.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: A single tree gave shade from the sun.
They won the game by a single point.
the highest price ever paid for a single work of art
a single-sex school (=one for only boys or girls)
single.translation[0].definitions[1].def: not married, or not involved in a romantic relationship with anyone
single.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The changes in tax rates will benefit single people the most.
single.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a single ticket etc is for a trip from one place to another but not back again
single.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a CD that has only one song on it, not a number of songs, or a song which is sold in this way
single.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Have you heard their latest single?
single.translation[1].definitions[1].def: one run2 in a game of cricket
single.translation[1].definitions[2].def: a hit that allows the person who is hitting the ball to reach first base in a game of baseball
single.translation[1].definitions[3].def: a ticket for a trip from one place to another but not back again
single.translation[1].definitions[4].def: a piece of paper money worth one dollar
single.translation[1].definitions[5].def: a room in a hotel for just one person
single.translation[1].definitions[5].exa: I’m afraid we haven’t got any singles available.
single.translation[3].definitions[0].def: a ticket for a journey from one place to another but not back again
